  • About

    More about me.

Chris Meyns is a researcher, writer and manuscript lover with some quirky ideas about reason and plasticity.

I am a researcher in philosophy at University College London. In the 2014/15 academic year I hold a Visiting Research position at the University of Toronto. My work is in metaphysics, philosophy of psychology, and early modern philosophy. Prior to joining London and Toronto, I held visiting positions at Yale University and LMU Munich. A copy of my CV can be found here.

My current research project, The Individuation of the Powers of the Soul, concentrates on early modern accounts of psychological capacities, such as sense perception, thought, and memory. In addition, I have worked on imagination, plasticity, distinction and explanation, and psychological essentialism.

Updated January 05, 2015
